page.title: 08Church of Scotland Craignish
page.content: Although the block lies within two parishes the Kilmartin side is almost unpopulated so reference is made only to Craignish Parish Church (dated 1826) in Ardfern village. As the minister also serves the parish of Kilninver-Kilmelford, only the morning service (and a Sunday School) is held here. The minister covers a very wide area visiting the elderly, those in hospital and the bereaved. He is a regular caller at local schools and involves himself in all aspects of the local community including the yachtsmen. Within the last year there have been 3 baptisms and 3 funeral or memorial services. The last wedding service was about two years ago. The church has no graveyard.Burials at Kilvaree (3 miles) cremations at Cardross or Clyde -Bank (almost 100 miles away!).
